meanings.definition: A device that produces a flame or heat for cooking.
meanings.sent1: The burner on the stove heated up the soup quickly.
meanings.sent2: She turned on the burner to cook dinner for her family.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally left the burner on all night, turning the kitchen into a sauna.
meanings.sent4: His passion for cooking was like a burner, always ready to ignite new culinary creations.
meanings.sent5: The bright blue flame of the burner danced gracefully beneath the pot.

meanings.definition: A person who burns something, such as a criminal.
meanings.sent1: The arsonist was known as a dangerous burner in the city.
meanings.sent2: The forest fire was started by an unknown burner.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy burner accidentally set fire to his own shoes while camping.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held the intensity of a burner, capable of scorching anyone who crossed her.
meanings.sent5: The detective was on the trail of the notorious burner responsible for multiple arsons.

meanings.definition: A part of a stove that generates heat for cooking.
meanings.sent1: The metal burner glowed red as it cooked the pancakes.
meanings.sent2: She cleaned the burner carefully to prevent any food from burning.
meanings.sent3: The burner on the stove decided to go on strike, leaving them with cold leftovers.
meanings.sent4: The burner hummed softly, filling the kitchen with warmth and the smell of dinner.
meanings.sent5: The old stove had a faulty burner that always took longer to heat up.

meanings.definition: A disposable phone used for temporary communication.
meanings.sent1: He bought a burner to use while traveling and kept his main phone safe at home.
meanings.sent2: The criminal tossed the burner phone into the river after making the call.
meanings.sent3: She felt like a secret agent using a burner phone to make mysterious calls.
meanings.sent4: The burner phone buzzed with messages from unknown numbers.
meanings.sent5: The burner phone was a lifeline in emergencies, ensuring help was just a call away.
